website_summaries.verdict: A lightweight shoe that offers great support and traction.
pros: Sturdy, and has good ankle support and traction
Great look, and most buyers felt the fit was perfect
cons: There were some complaints of these being too narrow, so consider buying up a half size if you have wider feet
Some felt this wasn't the easiest shoe to get on or off

customer_reviews.title: The Perfect Boxing Shoe
customer_reviews.text: These are great shoes. I been wearing Machomai for a while now but couldn't find my size so I grabbed these and I WILL NEVER GO BACK. These are great looking, light, comfortable and really anchor you to the floor. They'll improve your balance and you'll find power you never knew you had. They're really spectacular. The fit is a little tricky. I was a 10 in machomai so I ordered a ten in these and they were too big, mostly too long. I sent them back for a 9.5 and they're perfect without socks, which is my preference. The strap is long so you have to tweak it a little.
customer_reviews.author: Bongo Charm

customer_reviews.title: A good shoe but ...
customer_reviews.text: These are some nice boxing shoes . I spend mist of my time working on foot work .. I train 3 days 1.5 hrs .. each session boxing .. I would say half the time I spend on foot work .. I had to send the shoes back due to the rubber coming off the bottom of the shoes .. I did however like the tightness of the shoes and much support it gave me .. I’m going to order a pair of adidas to see if I have any better luck !
customer_reviews.author: noah

customer_reviews.title: Great pair of training shoes
customer_reviews.text: These are my first pair of boxing training shoes and they are light makes running and jump rope and its easy to stay light on your feet.
customer_reviews.author: JXE97

customer_reviews.title: Best review
customer_reviews.text: These feel great and I use them for weightlifting and they work great in every lift form squat to power clean. Not to mention how good they look while doing the lifts. They fit kinda snug but just loosen the strings up alot and they fit good, I wear a 10.5 in every shoe but I thought I should get an 11 in this one so I have some room but they didn't have 11 so I got 10.5 so be sort of carefull about the size. But all things aside they fit good and look even better.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Quality shoe, but overly narrow.
customer_reviews.text: I have decently wide feet, nothing too extraordinary. But this shoe was more narrow than what I would've thought. Not going into that too much, just be aware. Overall, I love the shoe. I've used them about 5 times now while training as a boxer and they are great in the ring and during workouts. I recommend this shoe to people who don't have really wide feet.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: not as nice as i'd hoped, i sent them back
customer_reviews.text: they seemed to fit ok, they just didn't seem as well put together as i'd hoped/thought they should be. i was disappointed to send them back, i really wanted to like them but couldn't.
customer_reviews.author: AF

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe
customer_reviews.text: Shoes were shipped from America to Australia in quicker than expected time and look even better than I imagined. The sizing is a bit off though. I went in store to try a different reebok shoe on and ordered these boxing shoes in my regular size. I size up wouldve made a slight difference in making it easier to get the shoe on as the really are quite narrow. I had to un do the laces really loosely for my feet to fit but once they did they fit perfect and pulled in nice and tight. Very light and comfortable
customer_reviews.author: Joel

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes but I have narrow feet and it ...
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes but I have narrow feet and it is hard to get them to fit right. This is a normal problem for me but it is the best boxing boot I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: Cobra

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe. Work well in the ring. Use them sometimes outside of the ring.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe. If fits snug but that is what you want. It will fit true to size. Tight when you first wear them but after you break them in very comfortable. The strap adds ankle support which is great. I play basketball in them too.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Somerville

customer_reviews.title: very happy
customer_reviews.text: I just got these last week and have trained in them a few times (boxing). So far, I'm really happy with the purchase. They fit as expected, offer good support and traction, and are comfortable and surprisingly light weight for their size. They look great too -- I've received multiple compliments and questions on where to buy them.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: They fit great!
customer_reviews.text: They fit very good a little tight but expected for the break in period but overall good!
customer_reviews.author: Estevan Hincapie

customer_reviews.title: They’re great
customer_reviews.text: Bought them for my boyfriend. They were a little narrow but fit good just need to break into them. Worth the buy!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Coulter

customer_reviews.title: Light, sturdy but width is an issue!
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes overall. Light, strong and hoping that they last a while as they are so good. The only issue I have is that the width is pretty small. I had to redo the laces so that they fasten up the sides rather than across. However, once done my wide feet can fit. Overall, a great pair of shoes for training in the ring.
customer_reviews.author: Rawlie

customer_reviews.title: Durable boxing shoes do not get stuck on the ring
customer_reviews.text: Excelente Boxing Shoes, great ankle protection, and good arch support
customer_reviews.author: SG

customer_reviews.title: Deadlifting
customer_reviews.text: Great for deadlifting. Shoes are very snug and very grippy. Nice and flat, no squishy soles. Stable.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Still breaking them in, but they've been great so far. AWESOME!!
customer_reviews.author: Prodigy

customer_reviews.title: I like it very much
customer_reviews.text: Very nice n light. Great for work out n even casually
customer_reviews.author: Hassan Alhilal

customer_reviews.title: Love them
customer_reviews.text: This has to be the most comfortable gym shoes that I have ever tried. On top of that they look cool
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ughhh
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because I thought Floyd mayweather needed more money
customer_reviews.author: Billy

customer_reviews.title: ON POINT!!
customer_reviews.text: Very light weight, comfortable and give great ankle support. They look best with jeans for my particular style. Love them!
customer_reviews.author: LGDonche

customer_reviews.title: It’s okay invest in a better pair
customer_reviews.text: The shoe fell apart after about 6 months of usage.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Felt snug at first but good once you break them in
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel

customer_reviews.title: A little narrow
customer_reviews.text: If you have somewhat wide feet. Probably go for rival shoes. But these shoes keep you on the balls of your feet and allows good footwork
customer_reviews.author: Cameron Bisbe

customer_reviews.title: Reebok Rocks....
customer_reviews.text: Love the shoe....I had a Nike boxing shoe and really liked it...however, it did not provide enough support. This shoe is rock solid, looks nice and a bit more heavy duty than my Nike. I am by no means a pro boxer, but do box 3X a week with this shoe. I am a size 8, bought an 8, and am very satisfied with the purchase,
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: Best shoe for the price
customer_reviews.text: Awesome shoes was hesitant on buying them at first but I'm glad I did. Nice support anf structure for Boxing. Happy with the overall quality and feel these are by far the best shoe for the price these are tried and true. My brother bought the Adams Boxing shoes a week ago and these are way better quality glad I didn't get those instead. He paid $140 for his shoes as well.
customer_reviews.author: ElevationBoxing

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great for boxing I love it nothing like kicking ass and looking good while you do it
customer_reviews.author: Joey

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Shoe is amazing fits good super light and looks apart.
customer_reviews.author: christopher

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great fit, fits true to size. Very light weight. Great traction.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: Velcro straps?
customer_reviews.text: Seems sturdy and good quality even though very lightweight. I bought these for use in a fitness kickboxing routine, not actual sparring...so I dont know if these shoes are unusual in that they take a long time to take on and off---the eyelets are tight and its a pain to tighten them and loosen them enough to get off. Also, I got these high tops bc I needed good ankle support--- Im a big guy with big calves, but even so, the velcro straps cinched all the way still fit loosely.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Too narrow
customer_reviews.text: I liked how they were for boxing but it's way too narrow. My feet aren't even that wide and just can't fit
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Size is larger than expected
customer_reviews.text: boyfriend normally takes a 10.5 US so thats what we ordered but they were too big. had to re-order for a 10 US and they fit him great
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fits good, is light and has great ankle support. I cant complain about anything yet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: They feel good and light we will see if the quality is good in time...
customer_reviews.author: Factory Rating

customer_reviews.title: “fits better than expected
customer_reviews.text: I wish there were an option that said, “fits better than expected.” These are without a doubt the best fitting shoes I ever worn. Slightly more heavy than the boxing shoes I’m accustomed to, but more sturdy. All and all a good shoe
customer_reviews.author: Skyler

customer_reviews.title: RARE BOXING BOOTS! WORN BY MAYWEATHER HIMSELF! HARD TO FIND ELSEWHERE
customer_reviews.text: I WOULD RECOMMEND GETTING HALF A SIZE LARGER THAN USUAL SINCE YOU HAVE TO MOVE A LOT IN BOXING AND YOU WILL LIKELY WEAR SOME LONG SOCKS ALONG WITH IT ANYWAY. HEEL FEELS A BIT TIGHT BUT ILL TRY MY BEST TO LOOSEN THEM UP. THESE ARE THE OFFICIAL FLOYD 'MONEY' MAYWEATHER BOXING BOOTS ALTHOUGH, HE CUSTOMIZES ALL HIS SHOES. THEY ARE GREAT BOOTS FOR BOXING. WOULD DEFINITELY RECOMMEND SINCE I HAD BEEN WAITING TO GET A HOLD OF THESE RARE SHOES.
customer_reviews.author: Syed Abbas

customer_reviews.title: Good looking but not for boxing.
customer_reviews.text: Good looking shoe but not good for boxing/training. Go with a company that knows how to make boxing shoes. Wearing the wrong type of shoes for boxing training is a bad idea if you are serious about it. It can lead to pulled muscles in the foot.
customer_reviews.author: the guy

product_meta.title: Reebok Men's Boxing Boot-Buck Sneaker
product_meta.description:
Reebok offers a way to deliver power to every punch with the new combat noble trainer.

Reebok was founded for one of the best reasons possible: athletes wanted to run faster. So in the 1890s, Joseph William Foster made some of the first known running shoes with spikes in them. By 1895, he was in business making shoes by hand for top runners; and before long his fledgling company, J.W. Foster and Sons, developed an international clientele of distinguished athletes.
